Description: Phocaean red-slip shallow pottery bowl with short vertical wall, incorporating slight flange. Rouletted decoration on rim. Red slip. Medium fine, red-brown clay (2.5 YR 5/4) with white inclusions,
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes Phocaean red slip form 3, (Hayes 1972, 336-8, PRS3), common in Alexandria region (Tomber & Thomas 2011, 53, nos.108-9). Tomber, R. S. & Thomas, R. I. 2001. ‘Pottery from the Lake Mareotis Research Project’, in L. Blue & E. Khalil (eds), A Multidisciplinary Approach to Alexandria’s Economic Past: The Lake Mareotis Research Project. Oxford: Archaeopress, BAR International Series 2285: 37-61.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 58 no. E6 pl. 28.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.281) (Phase 3)
